solution.text:
Since Area is constant, Length and Breadth are inversely proportional. L \(\times\) B = A = K
Therefore, taking area constant, K = _{{10*j}}_ \(\times\) _{{5*k}}_ = _{{50*j*k}}_ cm\(^2\)
Hence, if Length = _{{10*k}}_ cm
Breadth =\( \frac {_{{50*j*k}}_}{_{{10*k}}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Breadth = _{{5*j}}_ cm

content.text: The length and breadth of a given rectangle are _{{10*j}}_ and _{{5*k}}_ cm. Given that the area remains constant find the breadth of the rectangle when length is _{{10*k}}_ cm.
